content:
I edit test cases because people keep playing...!
And remove the obscure part of non-alpha characters.

You must've added a visible test case with non-alpha characters. Otherwise, the validator doesn't match the test cases. Most of the solutions for this problem in clashes reaches 50% only as there is no constraints and the problem description is quite vague. Why it's vague? Because from the problem statement "word is a sequence of letters", but the output for validator 2 contains a hyphen.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is suitable for CoC. I am confident this is possible in any language, it is probably on the tougher side of challenges to pull off in 15 minutes but certainly possible.
My C++ solution: https://pastebin.com/c37QK1Lc

you should add a test case where extra spaces are in the middle of the sentence or strip/trim method will do the job !
Something like bb bb aa aa

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very good puzzle, just try making the statement more simple .

Modify the input sentence this way :
1-st word should have only letters with EVEN ASCII codes.
2nd word should have only letters with ODD ASCII codes.

and keep alternating between odd and even .

Using this pattern, some words might completely disappear, so be careful to not leave extra spaces.

The information given has spelling and grammatical mistakes and is difficult to understand. 

The comment about indexing doesn't really make sense since the input is given all as a single string, indexing the string will give you a character. (Maybe the input would be better given word by word in a loop?)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and good idea for this playmode.

Tried to clarify the task description a bit.... Please check it out whenever you have a chance. 
Also, if the input will be given word by word, the task will loose its complexity completely.....and it's a easy one as it is.

Thank you.
Ivan.

Hi there. 
I'm borrowing your statement. It's SO succinct ! Love it.
Also, I've added a bit of complexity.
Please re-check 3 tests for New-York. 

Thank you.

Done! 
Check out test2 and test3. : )

Thank you
You are right. I need to re-build it. I didn't clarify for myself what is the whole idea of these "test-validator" pairs.

Cool, thanks for taking a second look at the problem. Also, please check the following case "a-a a-a", it's hard to get what is the expected result for this test neither from the statement nor the original solution.

Not exactly what i have in mind.
With your modified example you break your input condition : "Space separated words"
You should keep this condition.
In my example if you keap "extra spaces" the result would be "bb   aa" (3 spaces). This is the edge case i was talking about.

I do not remember the previous version but now validator 2 and 3 are false because of the break condition. It is not possible to predict dash separated words and handle them correctly. Why in validator 3 it disappears ?????

Also it would have been better to add test case rather than modify, in order to avoid possible tricks (kinf of cheat) because not all statement objective are covered (like the one with extra spaces in the middle of the sentence), especially in golf mode.

You can golf more your solution here :p
(ord(y)%2==0) == (i%2==0)
=
ord(y)%2==i%2

The changes make it clearer. I agree, you are right it is better as a sentence rather than word by word.

I still think the goal description is a little bit wordy, it could be revised more to be less confusing. 
I think it's a nice idea for a challenge though so I upvoted it.

My C++ solution to this problem:
https://pastebin.com/GM19eZAx

Hello sir.
I've added a bit of complexity.
Please re-check 3 tests for New-York. 
If it's jiving, correct your solution . It's 50% failing now. : )

Fixed the solution, just needs some pre-sanitization now.
https://pastebin.com/c37QK1Lc
